metadata.title: CVE-2016-4538 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The bcpowmod function in ext/bcmath/bcmath.c in PHP before 5.5.35, 5.6.xbefore 5.6.21, and 7.x before 7.0.6 modifies certain data structureswithout considering whether they are copies of the _zero_, _one_, or _two_global variable, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of serviceor possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted call.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4538` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.0 - 7.0.4-7ubuntu2.1
libphp7.0-embed - 7.0.4-7ubuntu2.1
php7.0 - 7.0.4-7ubuntu2.1
php7.0-bcmath - 7.0.4-7ubuntu2.1
php7.0-bz2 - 7.0.4-7ubuntu2.1

criterions.comment: php7.0 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.4-7ubuntu2.1').
